intro: Cousinia tafreshensis, commonly known as the Tafresh thistle, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and sandy soils, demonstrating a high degree of adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are generally grayish-green with a fuzzy texture, and the flowers are small and clustered in a spherical shape. Cousinia tafreshensis plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and may have potential uses in ecological restoration projects.
